frontmatter.title: Wave Function Collapse
frontmatter.description: Wave Function Collapse is a general randomised space-filling algorithm inspired by quantum physics.

frontmatter.title: Voronoi Tesselation
frontmatter.description: Voronoi Tesselation is a procedure used to subdivide a plane into regions based on specific points called seeds.

frontmatter.title: Cellular Automata
frontmatter.description: Cellular Automata are a family of algorithms devised to observe and simulate complex systems in which local interactions have global impacts.

frontmatter.title: L-Systems
frontmatter.description: Parallel re-writing systems commonly used to recreate organic structures.

frontmatter.title: Slime Mould Simulations
frontmatter.description: An agent-based simulation of accretion processes as exhibited by organisms generically known as slime moulds.
